data.title: textEditor.revealRange always scrolls to left horizontally
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0-Insider
- OS Version: MacOS Sierra 10.12.6

`textEditor.revealRange` with specified lines range and character scrolls to the `0` character:
```
onCursorMove(e: vscode.TextEditorSelectionChangeEvent) {
  e.textEditor.revealRange(new vscode.Range(
                        Math.max(selection.active.line - 10, 0), selection.active.character,
                        selection.active.line + 10, selection.active.character),
                        vscode.TextEditorRevealType.Default
  );
}
```

So when I navigate to the EOL it's okay, then I press e.g. left then cursor goes one position left and horizontal scroll goes to zero:
![](https://media.giphy.com/media/3o6vXSBQtyFEtBGVdm/giphy.gif)

Also:
- selection.active.character is not zero (at the end of the line),
- seems like it doesn't depend on the revealType.

data.title: "---" is not seen as a block delimiter
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2 - OS Version: Windows 10 Steps to Reproduce: 1. create an `.html` file 2. add the following content: ``` --- this is frontmatter ---
this is a normal block
``` 3. reformat the code via `F1 -> Format Document` The reformatted code is ``` --- this is frontmatter ---
this is a normal block
``` --> frontmatter information was destroyed and the file is not usable as a template anymore. Reproduces without extensions: Yes This problem is somewhere in the gray zone between a bug (strictly speaking, it is not) and configuration (the behaviour as it is now breaks template files, making a function unusable) **Is it possible to have `---` treated as a block delimiter?**

data.title: Git.path from windows native bash
data.body:
This is my vscode config:
```json
{
    "terminal.external.windowsExec": "C:\\Windows\\System32\\bash.exe",
    "terminal.integrated.shell.windows": "C:\\Windows\\System32\\bash.exe",
    "git.path": "C:\\Users\\Me\\Documents\\Scripts\\git.bat"
}
```

windowsExec and windows works good but git.path dont work.. How i use windows **native bash** for vscode `git.path`?

And vscode git logs response:
```console
git rev-parse --show-toplevel
git rev-parse --show-toplevel
git status -z -u
git status -z -u
```

My bat script:
```bat
@echo off
C:\Windows\System32\bash.exe -c "git %*"
```

On refresh response alert:
```bash
Git: spawn C:\Users\Me\Documents\Scripts\git.bat ENOENT
```
Also i try with make better bat script, here is source:
```bash
@echo off

set _path=%cd%
set _path=%_path:"=%
set drive=%_path:~0,1%
set _path=%_path:~2%
set _path=%_path:\=/%

if %drive%==A set "drive=a"
if %drive%==B set "drive=b"
if %drive%==C set "drive=c"
if %drive%==D set "drive=d"
if %drive%==E set "drive=e"
if %drive%==F set "drive=f"
if %drive%==G set "drive=g"
if %drive%==H set "drive=h"
if %drive%==I set "drive=i"
if %drive%==J set "drive=j"
if %drive%==K set "drive=k"
if %drive%==L set "drive=l"
if %drive%==M set "drive=m"
if %drive%==N set "drive=n"
if %drive%==O set "drive=o"
if %drive%==P set "drive=p"
if %drive%==Q set "drive=q"
if %drive%==R set "drive=r"
if %drive%==S set "drive=s"
if %drive%==T set "drive=t"
if %drive%==U set "drive=u"
if %drive%==V set "drive=v"
if %drive%==W set "drive=w"
if %drive%==X set "drive=x"
if %drive%==Y set "drive=y"
if %drive%==Z set "drive=z"

set dir="/mnt/%drive%%_path%"

C:\Windows\System32\bash.exe -c "git %* --git-dir=%dir%"
```
And *vscode* terminal try to open git `/mnt/d/Program Files/Microsoft VS Code` directory, response:
```
Using git "/mnt/d/Program Files/Microsoft VS Code"
git version 2.7.4 from C:\Users\Me\Documents\Scripts\git.bat
git rev-parse --show-toplevel
git rev-parse --show-toplevel
git status -z -u
git fetch
git config --get commit.template
git show :c:/Users/Me/Documents/Scripts/git.bat
```

But this won't work :/ Is any other solution to add bash as git?
How to fix it and run it with native windows ubuntu bash? Thanks!

data.title: Iteration Plan for August 2017
data.body:
This plan captures our work in August. This is a **4 week** iteration. We will ship **early September**. The main focus remains the same as last iteration's: We continue pushing on #396 "Multi-folder workspaces", this is our roadmap #28344.

As in July, our team will operate with slightly reduced capacity. Being on the Northern Hemisphere means Summer is upon us and so, at any given time, a few of us will be busy recharging with friends and families. If you mention somebody in an issue and you don't hear anything for a couple of days, just picture them hanging out on the beach :beach_umbrella: or skiing in New Zealand :skier:.

## Endgame
- *August 29th*: Code freeze for the endgame
- *Sept 1th*: Endgame done

The endgame details for this iteration are tracked in #33215.

## Plan Items

Below is a summary of the top level plan items.

Legend of annotations:

| Mark | Description |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| :runner: | work in progress  |
| :hand: | blocked task |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration  |
| :large_blue_circle: | more details required |
| :red_circle: | missing issue reference |

### Workbench
Multi-folder workspaces #28344 (feature request #396) @bpasero @tyriar **@** **team**
- [x] migrate hot-exit data (do not prompt to save dirty files)
- [x] migrate UI state (local storage)
- [x] investigate to not require a window reload @bpasero @sandy081 (#32945)
- [x] migrate workspace settings if any @sandy081 (#32947)
- [x] revisit workspace file format @bpasero (#32946)
- [x] support to add a folder to a workspace from the command line @bpasero 

### Editor
- [x] Finish/polish Color Picker #32235 @rebornix @joaomoreno
- [ ] :runner: Refactor the Find widget so that it can be shared across components #32241 @rebornix
- [ ] :muscle: Explore additional column selection gestures #32491 @alexandrudima
- [x] Support for smooth scrolling #25286 @alexandrudima
- [x] Add support for setting the cursor from a Braille display #27216 @alexandrudima 

### Monaco Editor
- [x] New release of the Monaco Editor https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/issues/510 @rebornix

### Debug
- [x] Extension Debugging using inspector protocol Microsoft/vscode-node-debug2#4 @roblourens @weinand
- [ ] :hand: Investigate WSL support for debuggers [issues](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Adebug+label%3AWSL) @weinand

#### Protocol
- [x] Support `scriptParsed` like event in the protocol [debugadapter-node/108](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/108) @weinand
- [x] Add a `url` field to `source` objects  [debugadapter-node/125](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/125) #30996 @weinand
- [x] Include display hints on evaluation results [debugadapter-node/123](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/123) @weinand
- [x] Support links to source locations in OutputEvents [debugadapter-node/94](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/94) @weinand

### Terminal
- [x] Polish terminal switcher #32236 @lixire
- [x] Analyze specific needs for terminal accessibility @aefernandes @tyriar
- [x] Native node module to pull Windows process information #31818 @tyriar @lixire

### SCM
- [x] Initial support for multiple repositories in a workspace #31325 @joaomoreno

### Tasks
- [x] Contribute problem matchers for webpack #29619 @lixire

### Languages

#### Multi-root folder support
- [x] Support multi-root-folder setup for CSS/LESS/SASS #32486 @aeschli
- [x] Support multi-root-folder setup for JSON #32487 @aeschli
- [x] Support multi-root-folder setup for HTML #32489 @aeschli
- [x] Support multi-root folder setup for TypeScript #30414 @mjbvz

##### Language Server Support (vscode-languageclient, vscode-languageserver)
- [x] Multiroot language support for shared servers (server can handle multiple folders) https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/issues/232 @dbaeumer
- [x] Multiroot language support for isolated servers (server per folder, scoped settings) https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-languageserver-node/issues/235 @dbaeumer

#### HTML
- [x] Autoclosing tags support #2246 @aeschli

##### JavaScript/TypeScript
- [x] Adopt TS 2.5 #32109 @mjbvz
- [ ] :hand: Support external files supported by TS server plug-ins #30411 @mjbvz
- [ ] :hand: Explore compile-on save #32108 @mjbvz

### Extensions
- [ ]  :runner: Improve extension recommendations #32422 @ramya-rao-a
- [x] Provide extension authors with extension uninstall information #32765 @joaomoreno  

#### API
- [x] Finalize secure credential storage API #15414 @chrmarti
- [x] Support commands in the hover #29076 @jrieken
- [x] Explore support to open File/Folder dialog from an extension #13807 @jrieken
- [x] SearchProvider` propose API for contributing to Search #29194 @jrieken
- [x] Debug - add support for a debug configuration provider #32086 @weinand

### Extension Contributions
- [x] PHP parser maintenance https://github.com/Microsoft/tolerant-php-parser/issues/12 @roblourens
- [x] TaskProvider for `rake` https://github.com/rubyide/vscode-ruby/issues/192 @rebornix
- [x] Go enable the extension for the multiroot setup https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-go/issues/1142 @ramya-rao-a
- [x] Multi root support for vscode-eslint @dbaeumer 
- [x] Multi root support for vscode-tslint @egamma

### Engineering Items
- [x] Adopt latest Electron #28582 @tyriar
- [ ] :runner: Add watch-dog which can kill runaway extension host processes #26445 @alexandrudima
- [x] Implement extension host restarting #32768 @alexandrudima 
- [x] When encountering errors, identify the extension they came from #32766 #21302 @jrieken
- [x] Correlate unhandled extension host exceptions with extensions #32490 @alexandrudima

### Documentation
- [x] Recipe for using Tasks with webpack (see #29619) @lixire @aefernandes
- [ ] :runner: Recipe for debugging an electron app in TS https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-recipes/issues/10 @auchenberg

### Exploration
- [x] Analysis of current test runner extensions @aefernandes

----

### Deferred
- Continue improving  automated issue management #32238 @chrmarti
- Investigate improved support for webpack #32108 @mjbvz
- Extension search improvements (by category, trending) #33035 @sandy081
---
- Explore improve performance of quick open on Windows using  a native module #32237 @chrmarti
- Cleanup `ExtensionContext.workspaceState` when a workspace no longer exists #32461  @dbaeumer

data.title: Exception if file is missing.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

Steps to Reproduce:
In a definition provider extension;

1. Call `let newDocument = vscode.workspace.openTextDocument(newUri);` with a non existent file.
2. Handle the promise with `.then(resolve, reject)`

In the console, the extension throws;

`[uncaught exception]: [object Object]`

Also see [this](https://github.com/anacierdem/vscode-requirejs/pull/34)

data.title: files.include setting OR a [^] "not" character class in files.exclude setting
data.body:
My use case is that VS Code is great for markdown. I want to be able to open a root folder and *only* show markdown or image files, but ignore everything else. 

Currently, with project settings, you can exclude certain files, but I essentially want the opposite: a setting that will only show files that matter for editing w/in VS Code (in this case, the markdown files). 

As an example, imagine wanting to document your 'My Documents' folders, or your Dropbox folder, etc. with markdown, but not actually wanting to open all files at the root of 'My Documents' in the context of VS Code. You just want to see the overlayed markdown  as use it as a "local wiki", which may or may not contain links to those files.

data.title: Clicking on LR / CRLF on the bottom brings up the menu at the top
data.body: When clicking on LF or CRLF on the bottom of the screen in the blue line, the menu to change it to the other line end type comes up all the way at the top of the screen.  That doesn't make any sense if I'm clicking on the bottom and looking at the bottom, the menu should come up next to the area I clicked on, not in a completely different area of the screen.

data.title: VS Code no longer respects remapped escape key using xmodmap
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:26:08.116Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.9.6-gentoo-r1
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
head-file-guard|bjr|0.0.2
python|don|0.7.0
vscode-rust|kal|0.4.2
cpptools|ms-|0.12.2
final-newline|sam|0.3.2
change-case|wma|1.0.0
---

I use xmodmap to swap the meaning of the Esc and Caps Lock keys. In other words, I press the physical Esc key to enable caps lock (very rare) and the physical Caps Lock for escape (very common). This used to work fine in VS Code 1.8.1 but misbehaves in 1.14.2. VS Code is the only software I have used that does this.

Swapping Esc and Caps Lock is common among Vim users, who frequently use the Esc key. See e.g. http://vim.wikia.com/wiki/Map_caps_lock_to_escape_in_XWindows.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make a file swap_escape with the following content:
```
remove Lock = Caps_Lock  
keysym Escape = Caps_Lock
keysym Caps_Lock = Escape
add Lock = Caps_Lock
```

2. Use xmodmap to remap the keys
```
xmodmap swap_escape
```

3. Caps Lock should now perform the function typically assigned to Esc, and vice versa.

4. Select some text in VS Code. Press the Caps Lock key. Expected: text is unselected (because the key means escape to the OS). Observed: nothing happens.

5. Select some text in VS Code. Press the Esc key. Expected: selection remains, caps lock is enabled in the OS. Observed: Text is unselected _and_ caps lock is enabled in the OS.


Reproduces without extensions: Yes

New File 2. Set Syntax to PHP 3. Insert code snippet: ```php Expected (had to set syntax to blade to get it to look correct):

data.title: Enable search.useIgnoreFilesByDefault by default
data.body:
When we enabled .gitignore support in search, we couldn't enable it by default, because we didn't want to confuse people who upgrade vscode and then see fewer search results. So, we added this option to determine whether .gitignore files should be respected by default in new workspaces. After you do a search in a workspace for the first time, it will persist whether respecting .gitignore files is enabled. This has led to some confusion, #28332, #24030, and more.

I think that setting was only necessary for a couple releases. Now that the button is out there, current states are persisted, I think we should enable the setting by default. It won't fix the problem necessarily but it should diminish it over time.

data.title: Notifications : Accessibility: Add Keyboard Navigation To Notification Buttons
data.body:
Currently the only keyboard control of notification messages is Escape to clear the message
or messages.
There is an increasing number of notification messages with multiple important button options
and the only way to address them is with the mouse.

Proposal:
- Add Focus to notification message keyboard command
- Add keyboard controller to the notification widget to allow Left/Right/Up/Down button navigation
- Only remove notification message that has been selected and a button activated

data.title: Extension List : Accessibility: Allow Tab to Current List-Line Buttons and Action Items
data.body:
Currently in the extension sidebar list keyboard navigation of the list is separate from the tab index
which controls access to the buttons and action items. A keyboard user cannot navigate
to a line and its action bar items you have to tab from the top.
See:
#24119 

Proposed Solution:

- adding an action bar option for external tabindex control
- allow the the upper level container controller to use focus and selection
to control the tabindexes
- the extension action icons are now only enabled when focused or selected
- before this one had to go through the entire tabindex sequence
to go from a selected extension to using the action icons

I would like to update and resubmit my original PR if the above sounds good.
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/24628

data.title: Integrated Terminal Processes Not Stopped on VSCode Close or Reload
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Ent

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Using Vue.js CLI, create a new project
2. Open project with VSCode
3. Open integrated terminal
4. execute command:  npm run dev  (this will start up the auto reload feature of the Vue.js CLI and will launch the browser.)
5. Use the extensions tab and reload an extension or close VSCode.

Easy to follow steps for creating project and launching are here:  [https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/installation.html](https://vuejs.org/v2/guide/installation.html)

**Expected**:  VSCode would gracefully terminate the process running in the integrated command terminal. 

**Actual:** VSCode closes, but leaves the process started by the now closed integrated terminal running.  The only way to terminate the process is to use task manager.  This issue is very difficult to figure out the first time it happens.  In my case, I reloaded VSCode after starting up a terminal process.  When VSCode reopened, I tried re-running:  npm run dev.  I got a bizarre error about having the wrong version of Node.js installed on my machine.  An hour later I figured out what happened, but it was painful.

Please add a feature for VSCode to gracefully terminate any integrated terminal processes before it closes or reloads.

Thank you!!

Karl Shifflett
Microsoft MVP.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: MacOS FSWatcher issues
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: MacOS 10.12.6

Steps to Reproduce:

We are not able to reproduce this issue all the time, it happens sometimes but we are not sure about what triggers it.

We have some users at work using VS Code on Linux Mint and `fs.inotify.max_user_watches=524288` solved the issue but on MacOS we are getting the following error:

```
/Users/ivanfrantar/CODE/core/node_modules/duplexer/index.js:31
    writer.on("drain", function() {
          ^

TypeError: Cannot read property 'on' of undefined
    at duplex (/Users/ivanfrantar/CODE/core/node_modules/duplexer/index.js:31:11)
    at Object.module.exports (/Users/ivanfrantar/CODE/core/node_modules/stream-combiner/index.js:8:17)
    at childrenOfPid (/Users/ivanfrantar/CODE/core/node_modules/ps-tree/index.js:50:6)
    at kill (/Users/ivanfrantar/CODE/core/node_modules/nodemon/lib/monitor/run.js:271:7)
    at Function.run.kill (/Users/ivanfrantar/CODE/core/node_modules/nodemon/lib/monitor/run.js:204:9)
    at Bus.<anonymous> (/Users/ivanfrantar/CODE/core/node_modules/nodemon/lib/monitor/run.js:336:7)
    at emitOne (events.js:120:20)
    at Bus.emit (events.js:210:7)
    at restartBus (/Users/ivanfrantar/CODE/core/node_modules/nodemon/lib/monitor/watch.js:162:7)
    at FSWatcher.filterAndRestart (/Users/ivanfrantar/CODE/core/node_modules/nodemon/lib/monitor/watch.js:145:16)
```
The error comes form nodemon but based on the experience on Mint we think is related with the FS Events... kind of like https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7950#issuecomment-320277006 but on MacOS.

Reproduces without extensions: We have not been able to confirm this...

data.title: Alt button for Menu intermittently working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:34:09.706Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
- Extensions: none
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch Visual Studio Code
2. Press Alt+F (or any other Alt+ menu combo)

Expected Outcome: File menu would open.

Actual Outcome: nothing happens.

Note: This issue appears to be intermittent.  When I first installed VSCode, the Alt button did not work.  Yesterday, it worked fine for me all day.  Today it is not working again.  I have not been able to identify a pattern yet.

data.title: Markdown mode cannot open links that contains some codes by percent-encoding.
data.body:
I wrote some links to web page and clicked it.
But all links, that were containing code of 0x80-0xff by percent-encoding, could not open browser.

For example:

~~~
* Following links can open browser:
  * [@](https://www.google.co.jp/search?q=%62%69%67)
  * [@](https://www.google.co.jp/search?q=%00) (only Linux)
  * [@](https://www.google.co.jp/search?q=%01)
  * ...
  * [@](https://www.google.co.jp/search?q=%7f)
* Following links cannot open browser:
  * [@](https://www.google.co.jp/search?q=%91%E5)
  * [@](https://www.google.co.jp/search?q=%00) (only Windows)
  * [@](https://www.google.co.jp/search?q=%80)
  * ...
  * [@](https://www.google.co.jp/search?q=%ff)
~~~

Every links show balloon tips of "Ctrl + click to follow link".
And the preview mode of markdown shows same behavior.

My environment is below:
* Windows
  * Windows 7 Ultimate 64bit Japanese
  * vscode 1.14.2
  * Firefox 54.0.1 64bit
* Linux
  * Ubuntu 14.04.5 LTS 64bit
  * vscode 1.14.2
  * Firefox 54.0 64bit

Good regard.

data.title: Cannot recognize .gitignore when open subfolder of a repository
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: win10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make a git repository (assume it's `E:/repo`)
2. Open folder `E:/repo/sub` in VsCode
3. `E:/repo/.gitignore` ignored /sub/test.txt
4. create a file `E:/repo/sub/test.txt`

**Expect**
`test.txt` not appear in changelist

**Actual**
`test.txt` does appear in changelist

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: How to write a code snippet generating current time?
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

I want to write a code snippet used to write the time when I write the code.
For example, I define a code snippet named timeit, and then when I write timeit, it will generate:

> write on 2017.8.4

However, I don't know how to generate the current time. Please give me some advice. Thank you.
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Snippet expansion drops escaped backslashes.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.14.2 (cb82febafda0c8c199b9201ad274e25d9a76874e, 2017-07-19T23:26:08.116Z)
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.12.3-1-ARCH

For snippets with escaped backslashes more backslashes are required than expected. For example, if the snippet has the format `"a\\b"` with `n` backslashes the outputs for various `n` are as follows:

```
2  -> a\b
4  -> a\b
6  -> a\\b
8  -> a\\b
10 -> a\\\b
12 -> a\\\b
...
```

Given that the output for 2 backslashes is identical to the output with 4 backslashes suggests that something is off here.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a snippet like this:

```JavaScript
"Test": {
	"prefix": "test",
	"body": "a\\\\b"
}
```

2. Insert snippet.
3. Check output for number of backslashes.
4. Expected: 2 | Actual: 1

Reproduces without extensions: Yes
